content.title: Cash Award to the Meritorious Visually Impaired Students Obtaining First Three Ranks at the State Level in the SSLC and HSC Examination
content.details: The scheme 'Cash Award to the Meritorious Visually Impaired Students Obtaining First Three Ranks at the State Level in the SSLC and HSC Examination' was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry. The objective of this scheme is to award cash prizes to meritorious differently-abled persons (visually challenged students) who are studying in government and private schools of Puducherry and secure first, second and third rank concerning total marks in the Secondary School Leaving Certificate (SSLC) and the Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC) examinations.
benefits: A cash award of ₹20,000/- to the first rank holder
A cash award of ₹15,000/- to the second rank holder
A cash award of ₹10,000/- to the third rank holder
eligibility: The applicant should be a Native/Resident of the Union Territory of Puducherry for at least 5 years.
The percentage of the disability of the applicant should be 100% and above.
The applicant should have studied in Tamil or English Medium.
The applicant should have passed the qualifying SSLC & HSC Examination respectively.
content.application_process: Offline. The interested applicant should visit the Office/ Sub-Office of the Department of Social Welfare, request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form, fill in all mandatory fields, attach required documents, and submit it to the appropriate authority.
documents_required: Residence-cum-nativity Certificate, Issued by the Competent Authority

faqs.question: What is the medium of study required for eligibility?
faqs.answer: The applicant should have studied in Tamil or English Medium.

faqs.question: What documents are mandatory for application submission?
faqs.answer: Aadhaar Card, Residence-cum-nativity Certificate, Passport-size Photograph, Bank Passbook, Address Proof, Age Proof, Ration Card, Disability Certificate, and Study Certificate.

faqs.question: What are the cash prizes awarded under this scheme?
faqs.answer: ₹20,000/-, ₹15,000/-, and ₹10,000/- for the first, second, and third rank holders respectively.
